intro: Hyoscyamus minor, commonly known as lesser henbane, is a herbaceous annual plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the nightshade family (Solanaceae) and is characterized by its distinctive yellow flowers and hairy stems. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and has alternate, ovate leaves with serrated edges. Its flowers bloom in late spring to early summer, and the plant produces small, round berries that contain toxic seeds. Due to its toxic properties, it is often considered a weed and requires caution when handling.
